I have a list of things I want to get to but I want to start out by saying that I really enjoy this game. The vast amount of killers can make every game feel different and unique. Seeing killers like Pinhead from HellRaiser, Micheal Myers from Halloween, and other popular movies excites me to play them. From many of these movies or tv shows, you have survivors who are fun to play as too, but I don't get as excited about them and I will explain why.

Pros:
-Playing Killer can be a unique experience every game
-Vast amount of killers to choose from with unique play styles
-Mix and match tons of perks to create a unique loadout in survivors and killers
-Constant updates to keep the game alive
-Relatively short matches (10ish mins)

Cons:
-There is a meta with perks
-Trolling is a huge issue
-Skill based matchmaking or MMR is completely busted
-Survivors have little value in who you choose
-Pay to win?

Let's break this stuff down. I have around 125 hours in this game at the time of this review. I have run into 1 hacker and I have trolls nearly every other game. Trolls consist of people who teabag you as you chase or when you make a mistake as killer, hide in lockers all game so it is hard to find them, bad chat behavior, and 90 percent of the time before a survivor leaves exit gate or hatch, they wait for you to see them teabag you as they leave in victory. The MMR in this game is horrendous, you could be a bronze level player and get matched with Red Rank 1 players who are the best in the game, and then your next game is unranked players. There is a meta, and you can expect it to be toxic in higher ranks. Playing as killer, you will constantly see the same perks being used because they are good perks, but combined with others to create this loadout of "haha you can't get me" is annoying and can be tough on the killer. Lastly, survivors are only important to play as until you reach level 40 with them. This unlocks their unique perks to be used in other survivors loadouts and therefore makes them no longer unique. They become just skins. Lastly, pay to win... in short, its a yes, and a no. Yes because you can eventually unlock new perks that are in the meta and you become way stronger using those than what the game gives you without buying any DLC. No because you can still be really good at this game and use the perks given to create a new advantage and way to win. However, I do think there is a bit of a paywall to getting those perks and creating a good build that I think would increase your winrate drastically. 

If you made it past that then good, because if you ignore all of that, this game is awesome. I love being able to switch between different killers using different abilities. Coordinating with other survivors to power on all gens is fun and when you win, it feels good to have beat the odds. I recommend this game and I see the issues I have listed being worked on and hopefully fixed.

This is a very good game. When they said that "Stranger Things" was going away, I couldn't wait for Black Friday, I had to buy it now. I wish that it would stay around for 1 week longer, though, because I still need to get stuff.

I've played this game for over three years now and used to enjoy it, but ever since SBMM was introduced, combined with the already irritating SWFs on Discord, the game has become unplayable as Killer. Constantly being lobbied with a higher ranked team coordinating on Discord means 4 out of 5 matches involve simply being trolled. There's no learning curve any more because there's no happy medium, you either derank to the point you walk over a low ranked team or win a couple of those and immediately get pummelled by high ranks. This also means if you buy a new killer, there's no fair arena to test it out properly with the right balance of challenge. Under the old system there was at least a modicum of skills progression in the teams you were facing.

Probably a great game if you're a streamer who can put the hours in enough to be Red Ranked skill full time. For the casual player though, it's getting to the point where playing as anything other than survivor will just end up making you want to uninstall.

This game fucking sucks. Matchmaking sucks. Some perks so overpowered it fucking sucks. Can only play this game with friends.

The Pros:
Easy play style; Matches only last 15-20 min (easy to stop and start); It can be *enjoyable* on occasions. I'd say about 1 in 4 matches can loosely be defined as "fun".

The Cons:
Addictive in a low tier drug kinda way, like getting your next fix even though you don't feel anything anymore; Frustrating as 3/4 matches have toxic players or DC's or some bug impedes overall game play experience and makes you hate the game; Behaviour don't care about community feedback or make any effort to reduce toxicity in game.

Conclusion:
Don't buy this game it's a trap! It gives you a false sense of enjoyment at times but at most times you're incredibly frustrated and don't want to play even though you do because you feel dead inside. You play even while it's daylight outside for the little bump it gives you. You become dead by daylight.
Imagine Starcraft 2 developers were bronze league players and balanced the game in order to make it more fun for themselves.. Welcome to Dead by Daylight!
